name: A Man Of Few Words
description: Darvo needs your help again. Save one of his best contractors from Grineer execution.

name: Apostasy Prologue
description: Inspect your personal quarters upon finishing the Chains of Harrow quest.

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Update 23
patchlogs.changes:
The Apostasy Prologue left a memento from the Lotus lingering in the Orbiter, calling back to the moment Ballas extended his hand to her. As they faded beyond grasp, nothing but fragmented transmissions from her remained.
THE SACRIFICE Quest is available after completing The Second Dream, The War Within, Chains of Harrow and the Apostasy Prologue, and will be available in your Codex upon login. Bring your best Warframe and Operator loadouts to face the challenges that await you in THE SACRIFICE .

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.8.3
patchlogs.changes: You can now replay the Apostasy Prologue quest in your Codex! (Not that my body is ready for those feels AGAIN)

name: Chains Of Harrow
description: A strange transmission leads deep into the dark world of Red Veil mysticism. What evils will be found there and what do they want?

name: Hidden Messages
description: Seek out the Warframe Mirage

components.name: Argon Crystal
components.description: Void based radioactive resource that decays every day it is out of the void.

components.name: Blueprint
components.description: Seek out the Warframe Mirage

components.name: Orokin Cipher
components.description: This device is used to bypass Orokin encryptions.

components.name: Oxium
components.description: Oxium is a rare lighter than air alloy of Orokin origin.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Update 22: Plains of Eidolon
patchlogs.changes: Players who have the blueprints for The Limbo Theorem, Hidden Messages, or Patient Zero will now automatically receive the quest itself upon logging in. The blueprints will be removed and if they were under construction, the resources and credits will be refunded (except for the argon crystals for The Limbo Theorem, sorry!).

patchlogs.name: The Glast Gambit: Hotfix 19.11.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed one of the Hidden Messages quest node being labeled "Solve the Riddle from the Inbox Message", which defeats the purpose of the riddle.

patchlogs.name: Specters of the Rail: Hotfix 4
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue with the 'Hidden Messages' Quest not rewarding proper Blueprints when playing the corresponding nodes.

patchlogs.name: Update: Specters of the Rail
patchlogs.fixes: Sedna Junction: Hidden Messages Blueprint

patchlogs.name: Update 17.5: The Jordas Precept. + Hotfix 17.5.1
patchlogs.changes: Players can now skip the crafting stages of the Hidden Messages Quest if they already have built a Mirage.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed VO not properly triggering in the Hidden Messages Quest.

patchlogs.name: Update 14.1.0: Quanta & Dendra
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed issue with progression on the Mirage ‘Hidden Messages’ quest if you already crafted the Chassis or already own a completed Mirage.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 14.0.9
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the “Hidden Messages” quest giving the wrong inbox message on the third leg of the quest. This fix includes a less ‘chatty’ Ordis for that leg of the quest.

name: Howl Of The Kubrow
description: You are Tenno, you deserve a Kubrow by your side.

name: Jordas Golem Assassinate
description: Access this assassination mission by completing the Jordas Precept quest.

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Update 23.3.0 + 23.3.0.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Clients not getting credit for completing Jordas Golem Assassinate and Mutalist Alad V Assassinate missions.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Update 22: Plains of Eidolon
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Jordas being near invisible during transmissions in the Jordas Golem Assassinate mission.

patchlogs.name: Oberon Prime: Update 20.7.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Jordas Golem Assassinate mission reward being lowercase.

patchlogs.name: The War Within: Hotfix 19.0.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the level ranges displayed on navigation for the Jordas Golem Assassinate, Jordas Verdict, Law of Retribution, and Mutalist Alad V Assassinate.

patchlogs.name: Update 18.13.0: TennoGen, Passives, & Reworks
patchlogs.fixes: •    Fixed the ‘Projectile Incoming” warning message not appearing for Clients in the Jordas Golem Assassinate mission.

name: Mutalist Alad V Assassinate
description: Put an end to Alad V and his Mutalist experiments

components.name: Blueprint
components.description: Put an end to Alad V and his Mutalist experiments

components.name: Ferrite
components.description: Alloy pellets used in Grineer manufacturing.

components.name: Mutalist Alad V Nav Coordinate
components.description: Nav coordinates of Alad V's Infestation Research Ship

components.name: Nano Spores
components.description: Fibrous technocyte tumour. Handle Infested tissue with caution.

components.name: Nav Coordinate
components.description: Coordinate used to locate lost ships.

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Update 23.3.0 + 23.3.0.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Clients not getting credit for completing Jordas Golem Assassinate and Mutalist Alad V Assassinate missions.

patchlogs.name: The War Within: Hotfix 19.0.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the level ranges displayed on navigation for the Jordas Golem Assassinate, Jordas Verdict, Law of Retribution, and Mutalist Alad V Assassinate.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 18.4.10 & Tactial Alert: Divine Will
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Mutalist Alad V Assassinate Key displaying an incorrect description in the Foundry.

name: Natah
description: Strange drones have appeared in the Origin System, help the Lotus find out what they are and who sent them.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.1.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed a progress stopper in the Natah quest where drones would not spawn.

patchlogs.name: Update 21: Chains of Harrow
patchlogs.changes: Repositioned node to fix overlap of Natah quest text 'Find the Sentient Fragments' (Cressida) and Caleus on Uranus.

patchlogs.name: The Silver Grove: Update 1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Second Dream quest key being given as a reward from completing the Natah quest. Players must complete the Uranus to Neptune Junction as intended.

patchlogs.name: Specters of the Rail: Hotfix 1
patchlogs.changes: Removed the Natah and The Jordas Percept quests from Junctions as these are given out through server rewards.

patchlogs.name: Update: Specters of the Rail
patchlogs.fixes: Uranus Junction: Natah, Clem Quest

patchlogs.name: Update 18.1.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Natah Quest not being flagged as completed even after the player receives their reward.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 18.0.4
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an error preventing players for receiving their inbox reward for completing the Natah Quest.  Accounts that did not properly receive their reward have been reimbursed with this hotfix.

patchlogs.name: Update 18: The Second Dream
patchlogs.fixes: The Second Dream is available to all players who have completed the Quest: Natah.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.0.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Grineer spawning inside the wall during the the Defense mission in the Natah Quest.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.0.1
patchlogs.changes:
Quest: Natah:
Removed the Exilus Adapter Blueprint from Simaris, Natah Quest completion is now required to unlock this.

patchlogs.name: Update 17: Echoes Of The Sentient
patchlogs.changes: Exilus Mod slots can be unlocked using an item found in Simaris' offerings after completing the Quest: Natah, or can be purchased for 20 Platinum.

name: Octavia'S Anthem
description: Build the Mandachord and find the cause of Cephalon Suda’s erratic behavior.

name: Once Awake
description: Intercepted Grineer communications reveal that Grineer have been experimenting with some sort of bio weapon. You must investigate.

patchlogs.name: Beasts of the Sanctuary: Update 22.20.0
patchlogs.additions: Added the ability to replay the Once Awake quest !

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Update 22.6.0 + Hotfix 22.6.0.1
patchlogs.fixes: Several fixes to material and mesh in the Once Awake defense mission.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.2.5
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Infested Chargers not being able to damage the Cascade Bomb in the Once Awake quest due to an incorrect hitbox.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Update 22: Plains of Eidolon
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed misleading objective marker pathing in the Once Awake quest.

patchlogs.name: The Silver Grove
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an Infested object blocking the door near the end of the Once Awake quest.

patchlogs.name: Specters of the Rail: Hotfix 13
patchlogs.fixes: Fix a progression stopping issue in the Once Awake quest if the player switched their active quest before claiming the Heat Sword Blueprint, and then built and sold the Heat Sword before ever switching Once Awake back to being an active quest.

patchlogs.name: Update: Specters of the Rail
patchlogs.fixes: Mercury Junction: Once Awake, Howl of the Kubrow

patchlogs.name: Warframe: Sanctuary
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed players not receiving their reward for completing the Once Awake quest.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.15 + 15.15.01
patchlogs.changes: Reduced the number of scans required on the Bomb in the Once Awake Quest.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.13
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed redundant End Mission transmission that plays at the completion of the Once Awake quest.

name: Patient Zero
description: Find Alad V’s laboratory and put a stop to his madness

components.name: Blueprint
components.description: Find Alad V’s laboratory and put a stop to his madness

components.name: Nano Spores
components.description: Fibrous technocyte tumour. Handle Infested tissue with caution.

components.name: Neurodes
components.description: Biotech sensor organ harvested from Infested entities.

components.name: Plastids
components.description: A disgusting nanite-infested tissue mass.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Update 22: Plains of Eidolon
patchlogs.changes: Players who have the blueprints for The Limbo Theorem, Hidden Messages, or Patient Zero will now automatically receive the quest itself upon logging in. The blueprints will be removed and if they were under construction, the resources and credits will be refunded (except for the argon crystals for The Limbo Theorem, sorry!).

patchlogs.name: Update 19.13.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Patient Zero quest Mesa Specter holding a random purple object.

patchlogs.name: Recurring Nightmares: Hotfix #2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Nightmare missions appearing on quest nodes (e.g. Mutalist Alad V Assassination from Patient Zero quest).

patchlogs.name: Update: Specters of the Rail
patchlogs.fixes: Eris Junction: Patient Zero Blueprint, The Jordas Precept Blueprint

patchlogs.name: Update 16.4
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed a typo in the Patient Zero Quest line.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.6.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Patient Zero blueprint not appearing in Marketplace.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.5.7+15.5.7.1
patchlogs.changes: Removed Nightmare Mode from final quest mission in Patient Zero.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.5.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed error that would occur when attempting to select Patient Zero quest through World State Window if player had not yet unlocked Eris.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.5.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Patient Zero quest not completing for some players.

name: Sands Of Inaros
description: Help Baro Ki'Teer raid an ancient Martian tomb for a mysterious treasure.

components.name: Blueprint
components.description: Help Baro Ki'Teer raid an ancient Martian tomb for a mysterious treasure.

components.name: Nano Spores
components.description: Fibrous technocyte tumour. Handle Infested tissue with caution.

components.name: Nitain Extract
components.description: Each vial is produced by the painstaking expression of billions of rare, ocean-vent dwelling microorganisms.

components.name: Oxium
components.description: Oxium is a rare lighter than air alloy of Orokin origin.

name: Saya'S Vigil
description: On the Plains of Eidolon a mystery has lain buried for years: one that will mend or destroy a heart, and open the door to a hidden past.

name: Stolen Dreams
description: Find the thief Maroo and uncover the secrets of the Arcane Codices.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Update 22.10.0
patchlogs.additions: Added Replay Quest option for Stolen Dreams.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.0.2
patchlogs.changes: Updated an old Waypoint used in Stolen Dreams and The New Strange quests which was missing an in-world marker and yellow tint, this may have caused some confusion as all missions use the in-world marker now.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed a progression stopping issue in the Stolen Dreams where you were unable to ‘Find the Arcane Machine’.

patchlogs.name: Chains of Harrow: Hotfix 21.4.1
patchlogs.changes: Maroo will patiently wait for the Stolen Dreams quest to be completed before she starts offering you weekly Ayatan Hunt missions.

patchlogs.name: The War Within: Update 19.4.2 + 19.4.2.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Maroo not staying down after she is defeated in the Capture mission for the Stolen Dreams Quest.

patchlogs.name: Update: Specters of the Rail
patchlogs.fixes: Phobos Junction: Stolen Dreams

patchlogs.name: Update 16.3: The New Protocols
patchlogs.fixes: Lowered the difficulty of the Spy Missions in the Stolen Dreams Quest.

patchlogs.name: Warframe: Sanctuary
patchlogs.fixes:
In order to obtain this new Quest, players above Mastery Rank 5 must first visit Cephalon Simaris in his Sanctuary after completing the Stolen Dreams Quest.  From there players can acquire The New Strange and accept it from the Codex once they return to the Liset.
Fixed the dialogue between Lotus and Maroo at the final mission of Stolen Dreams being out of order.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.16 + Tactical Alert!
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed issue where Stolen Dreams would become permanently stuck in the Quest log.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.14.0
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed Arcane Boiler appearing in lower case in the Stolen Dreams Quest details.
Fixed issue that caused players to have the Stolen Dreams Quest to be stuck as their active Quest.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.13.4
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed the Minimap in the final Mission of Stolen Dreams being misaligned.
Fixed Mission objectives not properly updating in Codex for the Stolen Dreams Quest.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.13.3
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Stolen Dreams Quest being replayable after completion.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.13
patchlogs.changes: A new character and a completely revamped version of Spy Mode await you in the Stolen Dreams Quest. Embrace your inner secret agent, Tenno!

name: The Archwing
description: The Balor Fomorians are coming but we are ready. Through your efforts we finally have a working Archwing prototype and I am sending you the blueprint. However, your task is not yet complete. You still must discover the component parts.

patchlogs.name: Beasts of the Sanctuary: Hotfix 22.20.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed invisible Archwing during the initial The Archwing quest cinematic.

patchlogs.name: Beasts of the Sanctuary: Update 22.20.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Excavators not spawning in The Archwing quest.

patchlogs.name: Update 21: Chains of Harrow
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed broken assets in the final room of the first Archwing mission in The Archwing Quest.

patchlogs.name: Octavia’s Anthem: Update 20.5.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the quest marker breaking in the first mission of The Archwing quest.

patchlogs.name: Octavia's Anthem: Hotfix 20.0.4
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Excavators not spawning during The Archwing quest.

patchlogs.name: Banshee Prime: Hotfix 19.11.5 + 19.11.6
patchlogs.changes: Tweaked the last stage of The Archwing quest to include a UI objective text.

patchlogs.name: The Glast Gambit: Hotfix 19.9.1
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed initial objective markering not popping up in The Archwing quest.
Fixed The Archwing extraction during the Balor Formorian phase not initiating when playing in a squad as per: https://forums.warframe.com/topic/713614-the-archwing-quest-during-balor-fomorian-part-is-impossible-to-finish-if-done-in-a-squad/

patchlogs.name: Specters of the Rail: Hotfix 11
patchlogs.changes: The Archwing Quest will no longer be given upon a player reaching Mastery Rank 2 since is it now a Junction reward.

patchlogs.name: Update: Specters of the Rail
patchlogs.changes: The Archwing ability stat screen will now show the correct range for abilities depending on context. (E.g. Blink used to show 100m, but in space you are 0.25x scale so distances are effectively 4x as far. So in space Blink will now show 400m. In water ranges are reduced, so Blink will show 39.69m.)
patchlogs.fixes: Mars Junction: The Archwing

patchlogs.name: Hotfix: Lunaro 7 + 7.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed incorrect localization in The Archwing quest.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 18.5.3
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue with The Archwing Quest not being completable for players, specifically players being unable to start the Balor Fomorian mission..

patchlogs.name: Update 18.5: Sands of Inaros
patchlogs.fixes:
Changed the number of Excavation extractions required in The Archwing Quest to 2.
Made various optimization improvements to the final Mission in The Archwing Quest.
Archwing Crafting requirements have been adjusted for players crafting the Odonata in The Archwing Quest:

name: The Glast Gambit
description: Nef Anyo has stolen the children of the Mycona Colony and it is up to you to get them back. You must challenge Nef on The Index and beat him at his own game. But Tenno, beware, not all is as it seems.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Update 22.6.0 + Hotfix 22.6.0.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the mission countdown starting right away when starting Index missions for The Glast Gambit through the World State Window, making it possible for players to start without having selected a Wager. Now the countdown shouldn't start until the player has selected their Wager on the screen.

patchlogs.name: Octavia's Anthem: Update 20
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed a progression stopping issue in The Glast Gambit if the Inbox mission flow was interrupted.

patchlogs.name: The Glast Gambit: Update 19.6.0 + 19.6.0.1
patchlogs.additions: Without spoiling too much, we have a script incoming that fixes and applies the proper Alignment choices made in The Glast Gambit between the window of Dec 22 9am ET and Dec 23 10am ET. Further investigation from reports showed that ‘Moon’ choices gave a ‘Neutral’ outcome and vice versa during this window (was later fixed).

patchlogs.name: The Glast Gambit: Hotfix 19.5.3
patchlogs.fixes: Full information on The Glast Gambit: Update 19.5 can be found here:

patchlogs.name: The Glast Gambit: Hotfix 19.5.1 + 19.5.2
patchlogs.fixes:
Full information on The Glast Gambit: Update 19.5 can be found here:
Fixed colony door messages not showing for clients in The Glast Gambit
Fixes indestructible tumors for clients in The Glast Gambit
Fixed a progression bug when aborting in The Glast Gambit
Fixed improper enemy scaling in the colony portion of The Glast Gambit
Fixed The Glast Gambit not properly registering alignment choice

patchlogs.name: The War Within: Update 19.4.2 + 19.4.2.1
patchlogs.fixes: As mentioned in the [PC Status Thread] Update 19.5: The Glast Gambit, update notes are pending as this was a rather sizable update and we want to assure we have everything accounted for. We also have our eyes peeled for any major bugs

name: The Jordas Precept
description: Ordis is determined to help a fellow Cephalon overcome a ship wide infestation.

patchlogs.name: Update: Specters of the Rail
patchlogs.fixes: Eris Junction: Patient Zero Blueprint, The Jordas Precept Blueprint

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.5.5
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed a typo in the The Jordas Precept Quest as per: https://forums.warframe.com/index.php?/topic/538745-de-please/

patchlogs.name: Update 17.5: The Jordas Precept. + Hotfix 17.5.1
patchlogs.changes:
New Quest: The Jordas Precept:
The Jordas Precept requires players to hunt the elusive Infested Juggernaut, who only makes an appearance after slaying multiple Infested shortly after his signature roar...
New Boss: J-3 GolemThe J-3 Golem has received a major overhaul since its last appearance, and can be found after completing The Jordas Precept Quest.
patchlogs.fixes: Thank you all for your patience and support!  We hope you enjoy Warframe: The Jordas Precept!

name: The Limbo Theorem
description:
The Limbo Theorem quest cannot be completed without an Archwing
Piece together the Limbo Theorem to uncover its source

components.name: Argon Crystal
components.description: Void based radioactive resource that decays every day it is out of the void.

components.name: Blueprint
components.description:
The Limbo Theorem quest cannot be completed without an Archwing
Piece together the Limbo Theorem to uncover its source

components.name: Neural Sensors
components.description: Implanted neural-link for controlling augmentations. Grineer design.

components.name: Orokin Cell
components.description: Ancient energy cell from the Orokin era.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Update 22: Plains of Eidolon
patchlogs.changes: Players who have the blueprints for The Limbo Theorem, Hidden Messages, or Patient Zero will now automatically receive the quest itself upon logging in. The blueprints will be removed and if they were under construction, the resources and credits will be refunded (except for the argon crystals for The Limbo Theorem, sorry!).

patchlogs.name: Update 21: Chains of Harrow
patchlogs.changes:
The Limbo Theorem (Jupiter-Europa Junction)
The Limbo Theorem Excavation missions will now guarantee one of the Blueprints at the end of 3 extractors as an End of Mission reward.

name: The New Strange
description: Work with Cephalon Simaris to find the source of a mysterious voice.

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Hotfix 23.0.3 - Limbo Prime
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed incorrect fly-in cinematic in The New Strange quest.

patchlogs.name: Beasts of the Sanctuary: Hotfix 22.18.7
patchlogs.changes: A prompt will appear that indicates you need to have a Rank 30 Warframe (Elite) and have completed The New Strange quest when selecting Sanctuary Onslaught if you do not meet those requirements.

patchlogs.name: Beasts of the Sanctuary: Update 22.18.0
patchlogs.changes: Must complete The New Strange quest.

patchlogs.name: Shrine of the Eidolon: Update 22.16.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed missing objective text in The New Strange quest.

patchlogs.name: Shrine of the Eidolon: Update 22.14.0
patchlogs.changes: Fixed enemies spawning on the wrong side of the portal in the final stage of The New Strange quest.

patchlogs.name: Shrine of the Eidolon: Update 22.12.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed a hitch in the final mission of The New Strange quest.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.0.2
patchlogs.changes: Updated an old Waypoint used in Stolen Dreams and The New Strange quests which was missing an in-world marker and yellow tint, this may have caused some confusion as all missions use the in-world marker now.

patchlogs.name: Hydroid Prime: Update 21.7.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Synthesis Targets sometimes not spawning in The New Strange Quest due to a broken path in one of the procedural levels.

patchlogs.name: Octavia’s Anthem: Update 20.2.0
patchlogs.changes:
You can now replay The New Strange quest! As with other replayable quests, completion rewards are not given
Removed requirement to go back to the Liset between some early stages of The New Strange if playing from the Relay.
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed a rare crash that occurred when playing The New Strange quest. 
Fixed missing/double Transmissions in the first mission of The New Strange.

patchlogs.name: The Glast Gambit: Hotfix 19.10.1+19.10.1.1
patchlogs.changes: For those players who did not receive the Chroma Blueprint after finishing The New Strange quest, you will now have one in your Inventory upon relogging into the game!

patchlogs.name: The Glast Gambit: Hotfix 19.7.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed a progression stopping bug in The New Strange quest if the Chroma Chassis was received but never built before Specters of The Rail released.

patchlogs.name: The Glast Gambit: Hotfix 19.6.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed not being able to progress through The New Strange due to having partially completed the quest before the Specters of the Rail update.

patchlogs.name: The Glast Gambit: Hotfix 19.5.1 + 19.5.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed automatic Quest progression in The New Strange

patchlogs.name: The War Within: Hotfix 19.3.2 + 19.3.2.1
patchlogs.changes: Removed The New Strange as a requirement for starting Simaris dailies.

patchlogs.name: Update 19: The War Within
patchlogs.changes: The New Strange Defense wave count has been reduced from 10 to 5.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue with the incorrect type of doors being visible during The New Strange quest.

patchlogs.name: The Silver Grove
patchlogs.fixes: Simplified The New Strange quest level layout and used more tiles themed around a secure facility.

patchlogs.name: Specters of the Rail: Hotfix 12
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed not being able to progress through The New Strange quest as per: https://forums.warframe.com/topic/676594-unable-to-progress-in-the-new-strange/

patchlogs.name: Specters of the Rail: Hotfix 4
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed a progression stopper in 'The New Strange' quest if players had already completed one or more of the crafting stages before the Update.
Fixed a progression stopper in 'The New Strange' where Elite Arid Lancers were required for scanning, now it just requires regular Arid Lancers.

patchlogs.name: Update: Specters of the Rail
patchlogs.fixes: Europa Junction: The New Strange, Limbo Theorem Blueprint

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.4.4
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue preventing players from accepting the Quest: The New Strange.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 16.8.3
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed a typo in ‘The New Strange’ Quest dialogue.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 16.1.3
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed the quest, The New Strange start and completion diorama automatically closing after a few seconds if the player is in a squad.
Fixed players being unable to accept The New Strange Quest with a controller.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 16.1.1
patchlogs.fixes: Liset transmissions relating to The New Strange quest will no longer continue to play while players are crafting parts.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 16.0.2
patchlogs.changes: ·         Chroma’s alt helmet will no longer appear in player inventories after completing The New Strange Quest.
patchlogs.fixes: ·         Fixed Sentinel NPCs, voice acting, or animations showing for Clients in the first mission of The New Strange Quest.

patchlogs.name: Warframe: Sanctuary
patchlogs.fixes: In order to obtain this new Quest, players above Mastery Rank 5 must first visit Cephalon Simaris in his Sanctuary after completing the Stolen Dreams Quest.  From there players can acquire The New Strange and accept it from the Codex once they return to the Liset.

name: The Sacrifice
description: A tortured vision sends the Operator on the hunt for a Warframe unlike any other.

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Hotfix 23.3.2
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed seeing double Operators in the final cinematic of The Sacrifice.
Fixed a blocky volumetric light during a cinematic in The Sacrifice quest.

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Update 23.3.0 + 23.3.0.1
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed inability to open the pause menu after viewing certain cinematic scenes during The Sacrifice quest.
Fixed "Falcon" Operator voice missing dialog during first mission in The Sacrifice quest

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Update 23.2.0
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed inability to place Komi stones in The Sacrifice quest if Jump and Move Up/Afterburner are bound to a different button when using a controller.
Fixed sometimes spawning in a mystical grey box room that you totally weren't meant to see during some certain missions in The Sacrifice quest.

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Hotfix 23.1.3
patchlogs.fixes: The Sacrifice: Hotfix 23.1.3

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Prime Vault Hotfix 23.1.2!
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed The Sacrifice Somachord fragment unlocks being in random order, which could result in fragments not spawning, or spawning when they shouldn't.

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Hotfix 23.1.1
patchlogs.changes:
The Sacrifice: Hotfix 23.1.1:
Items/resources dropped by Sentient in The Sacrifice quest have been removed. This follows precedent with other Sentient spawning related quests.
Removed the lore/Somachord Fragments spawning in the last mission of The Sacrifice quest. As you probably know, the pacing of that last mission doesn’t really warrant a Fragment search!

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Update 23.1.0: TennoGen Round 13
patchlogs.additions: The Sacrifice is now replayable!  2 new original quest songs have been added to the Somachord from the Sacrifice soundtrack. You can find and scan the Fragments by re-playing the quest!

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Hotfix 23.0.6
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed The Sacrifice quest progression stopper if you didn’t have a melee weapon equipped in the ‘Pursuing Umbra’ phase.
Fixed Octavia’s Mallet causing a progression stopping issue in The Sacrifice as reported here:

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Hotfix 23.0.5
patchlogs.fixes: The Sacrifice: Hotfix 23.0.5ui Improvements & Fixes:

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Hotfix 23.0.2 + 23.0.2.1
patchlogs.changes:
The Sacrifice: Hotfix 23.0.2:
Polished audio in The Sacrifice memory phases.
Improved some subtitle timing in The Sacrifice.
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed being unable to re-equip Umbra after The Sacrifice quest if you unequipped him.
Fixed the Courtyard Scene’s teleport volumes in The Sacrifice not resetting the player.

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Update 23
patchlogs.fixes: [SPOILERS] [PC] Update 23: The Sacrifice Quest Bug Report Megathread

name: The Second Dream
description: The Sentient Hunhow seeks to destroy the Tenno by exploiting long forgotten secrets.

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Update 23
patchlogs.changes:
Who would have thought that we’d be launching our third cinematic quest. With the ambitious goal of telling Warframe’s story in a way we had never done before, The Second Dream started it all. The moments you shared with us while playing through the quest is a memory all of us at Digital Extremes will never forget. So we thought… wow, we did it… Can we do it again? And so it was, we burned heaps of midnight oil to launch The War Within and experience the roller coaster of feels with you all over again.
THE SACRIFICE Quest is available after completing The Second Dream, The War Within, Chains of Harrow and the Apostasy Prologue, and will be available in your Codex upon login. Bring your best Warframe and Operator loadouts to face the challenges that await you in THE SACRIFICE .

patchlogs.name: Beasts of the Sanctuary: Hotfix 22.18.7
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed minor performance issue and crashing during the ‘Protect the Moon’ phase of The Second Dream.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.0.2
patchlogs.changes: The Focus School selection screen will now appear on login if a player has completed Second Dream but doesn't have a Focus ability selected yet. This should also fix people stuck in the War Within quest or The Second Dream quest.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Update 22: Plains of Eidolon
patchlogs.additions: It's been almost two years since we released the first version of Focus. Focus comes as a system unlocked upon completion of 'The Second Dream'. After answering a series of questions from The Lotus, you (the Operator) chose a Focus school and began your journey through a series of Passives that you needed to unlock all the while earning the Focus points to do so. Then came The War Within, where your Operator became playable with a few abilities meant mainly to help you earn Kuva and participate in Quests.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue in the final cutscene of The Second Dream quest where the Lotus and the Operator would disappear momentarily, giving players the ability to control their Warframe.

patchlogs.name: Octavia’s Anthem: Update 20.4.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fix the player's Warframe holding a 2nd copy of the Operator in their hand during The Second Dream.

patchlogs.name: The Glast Gambit: Hotfix 19.9.2 (Phase One: DB Upgrades)
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed a rare case of players sometimes not unlocking the Focus system when completing The Second Dream, which resulted in progression stoppers during The War Within.

patchlogs.name: Update 19: The War Within
patchlogs.additions: The next chapter to 'The Second Dream' has arrived. Knowing what the Tenno are is just the beginning of your story. It is time to face The War Within.
patchlogs.changes: Sorties were introduced in The Second Dream. They originally launched with 'Seasons' that rotated with set rewards. Since launch we iterated in several ways, including adding repeatable/non-repeatable rewards and more. Now we bring you more change with The War Within: Sortie Seasons are no more. We now have a set reward list of rewards that are always repeatable.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Operator’s not having visible fingers and toes in The Second Dream diorama.

patchlogs.name: The Silver Grove: U4+4.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed not being able to replay The Second Dream cinematic in the Codex.

patchlogs.name: Update: Specters of the Rail
patchlogs.fixes: Neptune Junction: The Second Dream

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 18.6.3
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an error causing Clients to remain on a black screen when attempting to load into The Second Dream’s Save the Reservoir Mission.

patchlogs.name: Update 18.4.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an error causing Clients to end up with 50 base Armor after completing The Second Dream.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 18.0.6 + 18.0.6.1
patchlogs.changes: Greater Lens Blueprints will no longer appear in the Market for players who have not completed The Second Dream Quest.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 18.0.4
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed improper visual FX playing over Sentinels and Kubrows when hit by Radiation while playing Missions in the second half of The Second Dream.
Fixed enemies not spawning with the correct level in the last Mission of The Second Dream Quest.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 18.0.2
patchlogs.additions: Players can now rewatch the Stalker Intro Cinematic from The Second Dream Quest via the ‘Rewatch’ button available in the Quest’s Codex.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 18.0.1
patchlogs.fixes:
• Fixed various issues with The Second Dream Quest (no spoilers).
• Fixed a hitch that would occur on the last mission of The Second Dream.

patchlogs.name: Update 18: The Second Dream
patchlogs.fixes:
The Second Dream is available to all players who have completed the Quest: Natah.
What we know of the Moon is a mystery, and entering its halls requires the completion of The Second Dream Quest.
An additional weapon may be hidden within The Second Dream.

name: The Silver Grove
description: New Loka seeks help protecting a sacred forest from Grineer incursions, but are they ready to face the forest’s true nature?

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Update 23
patchlogs.changes:
Who would have thought that we’d be launching our third cinematic quest. With the ambitious goal of telling Warframe’s story in a way we had never done before, The Second Dream started it all. The moments you shared with us while playing through the quest is a memory all of us at Digital Extremes will never forget. So we thought… wow, we did it… Can we do it again? And so it was, we burned heaps of midnight oil to launch The War Within and experience the roller coaster of feels with you all over again.
THE SACRIFICE Quest is available after completing The Second Dream, The War Within, Chains of Harrow and the Apostasy Prologue, and will be available in your Codex upon login. Bring your best Warframe and Operator loadouts to face the challenges that await you in THE SACRIFICE .

After answering a series of questions from The Lotus, you (the Operator) chose a Focus school and began your journey through a series of Passives that you needed to unlock all the while earning the Focus points to do so. Then came The War Within, where your Operator became playable with a few abilities meant mainly to help you earn Kuva and participate in Quests.

patchlogs.name: The War Within: 19.1.0 Ash Revisited
patchlogs.changes:
The War Within: 19.1.0 Ash Revisited:
Please note regarding these changes that we took the large 2000 Endo chances and chopped/reassigned to give a more diverse set of options to have variety of other rewards. We are aiming to make the full drop table more broadly appealing. When The War Within launched, we added Rivens to Sorties as a common drop to be the new, interesting, and unique evergreen goal for players in Sorties.  Rivens remain common with these changes as we see them as the ultimate goal for Sorties. Regarding Nitain specifically, the majority of our recently active players have less than 9 Nitain in their accounts and there is considerable interest in some new ways to acquire, so we are trying out Sorties as an option. A next step here is being considered to add a completely new Ayatan in the place of 2K Endo to give collectors and Endo hunters something to look forward to.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed occasional hitches in the The War Within quest.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 19.0.3
patchlogs.changes:
Fixed the Codex Entry for 'The War Within' not using the correct Operator. 
Refined the targeting of the Golden Maw for the 'Transference' portion of The War Within to be more user friendly.
Refined the contrast of the Archwing Lasers in the 3rd mission of 'The War Within' to be more colourblind friendly.
Fixed viewing other player's profiles showing your own 'The War Within' alignment.
Fixed snow appearing in cutscenes of The War Within after dying on the mountain pass.

patchlogs.changes:
The War Within: Hotfix 19.0.2:
Reduced the damage of Helios' Deconstructor in The War Within quest.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed a crash during The War Within quest.

patchlogs.name: The War Within: Hotfix 19.0.1
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed a crash if your Sentinel killed you during the Purge phase in The War Within Quest.
Fixed a crash during the Queen's fight in The War Within Quest.

patchlogs.name: Update 19: The War Within
patchlogs.additions:
The next chapter to 'The Second Dream' has arrived. Knowing what the Tenno are is just the beginning of your story. It is time to face The War Within.
If you do not receive The War Within Quest upon login be sure to have the Second Dream Quest and Sedna Junction completed. An inbox message will automatically appear once you have done so.
Once you've progressed far enough in The War Within to discover The Kuva Fortress, a new region will appear on your Solar Chart!
After you complete The War Within, Kuva Siphons may appear on Hard Grineer Environments (Sedna, Kuva Fortress, Uranus). These are side-quests related to the larger goals of the Grineer Empire. You will encounter new enemies here, and be required to use the skills learned in The War Within to prevail.
Fourth and fifth weapons exist… but defeating The War Within will be necessary to discover them.
A Mastery Rank 23 test has been added! The War Within introduces enough content to push long-term players that are currently Mastery Rank 22 into Mastery Rank 23!
patchlogs.changes:
Warframe Update 19: The War Within:
The War Within is here on PC! This is the next chapter in the story of Warframe. What we set out to do always seems a little wild in hindsight, but it's the thrill and ambition of storytelling that drives us to challenge ourselves and you. We want to grow and change Warframe in interesting ways. We're presenting you another chapter of growth today.
The War Within is also a reflection of lessons for us on how to feed, respect, and tame the growing animal that is Warframe. This update's name has outgrown itself and it represents something bigger. If you asked any of us 4 years ago what we expected to happen with this project, none of us would believe you if you showed us this day.
Ever since the change to the new Solar Chart in Specters of the Rail, the Invasion system hasn't exactly been exciting or novel. The War Within brings some much needed freshness to this part of the game!
Sorties were introduced in The Second Dream. They originally launched with 'Seasons' that rotated with set rewards. Since launch we iterated in several ways, including adding repeatable/non-repeatable rewards and more. Now we bring you more change with The War Within: Sortie Seasons are no more. We now have a set reward list of rewards that are always repeatable.
The new pre-requisite to access Sorties is completion of The War Within. 
There is a new addition to Sortie rewards, but this will be revealed upon completion of The War Within.
Volumetric Lighting technology is here and has been implemented in The War Within quest!

name: Vor'S Prize
description:
MY QUEENS -
You were right, the Tenno threat is real. We found one drifting near Pluto but the Lotus knew we were coming. She purged the Cryo moments before we had them and sent a squad of Tenno to break our assault.
They escaped. We are working on tracing them. Separate this Tenno from the flock and it should be easy to kill. We shattered its Warframe and expect such an abrupt Cryo purge will have damaged its memories.
We anxiously await punishment for failing this task.
- VOR
